No. 65. Consular. Legation of the United States, Monrovia Liberia, March 9, 1901.
Hon. David J. Hill Assistant Secretary of State Washington.
Subject. Anthony D. Williams Esq., a Liberian citizen, nominated for Vice Consul General, for Liberia.
Synopsis. Hon. Anthony D. WIlliams of Monrovia Liberia; ex Secretary of War and Navy, Liberian Government, is nominated as Vice Consul General for Liberia.

Mr. Cridler: Mr. Smith's original suggestion was that the office of V.C.G. need not be filled. We told him that it had better be filled and said we should be pleased to appoint Mr. Spurgeon to the position.

As Mr. Spurgeon is an American and Sec. of Legation it seems to me that his appointment as Vice Consul General would be better than that of a foreigner, even as good a man as Col. Williams appears to be.
No. 65. Consular. Legation of the United States. Monrovia Liberia; March 9, 1901.
Hon. David J. Hill, Assistant Secretary of State, Washington.

Sir: I have the honor to say, that in reply to your No. 37, Consular, of Jan. 31, 1901 (which reached me March 7, 1901), relative to the demise of Vice Consul General, Beverly Y. Payne, late of this Consulate General, with the further instruction, that it is the desire of the Department that a Vice Consul General be appointed; and that the Department would be pleased to Commission the Secretary of the Legation.
